items.preText: Bangladesh: 1 Tamim Iqbal, 2 Soumya Sarkar, 3 Shakib Al Hasan, 4 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 5 Mohammad Mithun, 6 Mahmudullah, 7 Sabbir Rahman, 8 Mashrafe Mortaza, 9 Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 10 Abu Jayed (ODI debut), 11 Mustafizur Rahman West Indies: 1 Shai Hope, 2 Sunil Ambris, 3 Darren Bravo, 4 Roston Chase, 5 Jonathan Carter, 6 Jason Hodler, 7 Fabian Allen, 8 Ashley Nurse, 9 Sheldon Cottrell, 10 Kemar Roach, 11 Raymon Reifer (ODI debut) Mohammad Isam says: "It is quite interesting to see the Bangladesh team management pick Abu Jayed, who was, a couple of days ago, being considered to be replaced by Taskin Ahmed in Bangladesh's main World Cup squad. So far BCB president Nazmul Hassan, who takes most of the selection decisions, said that the Jayed-Taskin situation will be decided after the Ireland tri-series." Yoel: "Do we have now a better idea as to who will be dropped to accomodate Gayle and Russell? Perhaps Campbell and Reifer/Allen?" -- From this XI, Jonathan Carter's place might be in danger as well when the big boys return. Syed Kabir: "There's also Hetmyer and Pooran to consider. Bravo's place should also be up for grabs." Sakeeb Ferdous: "Today's match is a crucial one for the Tigers to reach the final, which they will achieve if they win. However, in the broader context, it will also be a challenge for Mashrafe bin Mortaza and his troops to maintain their consistency as a unit ahead of the ICC World Cup. Mind it, Bangladesh have had only one full game in Ireland so far in this tournament. Will it be a loophole for Tigers today?" Badhon007 : "What is the point if you dont let Player like taskin, Reza, Yasir, Liton , Mosaddek play a single match in this tour . I know BD are focusing to give more match practices to main 11 . But If there is Tamim, Musi , Sakib , Riad and Mash against 2nd class windes team than how will others will do well in tough situations. Because more than often these 5 seniors will do ghe job for you" ---- Be careful writing them off like that. West Indies have a very rich and, importantly, veeeery recent history of making their critics eat their words. Moloy: "I think Nayeem should replace Mosaddek in the World Cup squad for Bangladesh.I personally think we r a spin bowler short.If and when required Liton can play as a lower order batsman if either of Sabbir and Mohamadullah is out of form or injured.He is also a backup opener.And most importantly also a Wicket Keeper. Any who agrees with me?" Nafis Sajid: "Good to see Abu Jayed gets a game.His selection is now getting a buzword in the country even the BCB president address it to the media.I hope he perform well today. BD should give Rubel a game here resting FIZZ before the World Cup as FIZZ is seen off form for last couple of games." Nitish: "When was the last time Windies played an ODI with two left arm seamers ?" --- Good question. I'm not entirely sure it happened even while Pedro Collins (he came to my mind only cause he's the last WI left-arm quick I can think of) was around Tohidul Tuhin: "Oh no! Windies will bat first once again. I hope they score a big total and put some pressure under Bangladeshi top and middle order. Would be great to see if Bangladesh have a finisher who could score 60 from 40 balls in the pressure moment. " West Indies have won the toss and have elected to bat. They don't have Shannon Gabriel in their line-up today. In his place comes Raymon Reifer, the left-arm fast bowler and lower order batsman. And as Isam hinted earlier, Saifuddin sits out and Abu Jayed gets a game. Tohidul Tuhin: "I was expecting Ireland to play a big innings against Windies and they did it. Today, I want Bangladesh to put a total of 350+ if they bat first. This sort of innings will enhance their motivation and inspiration to put big totals in the World Cup. Unlike the first ODI against Windies, I hope it to be a tough and challenging match for Bangladesh which would help bowlers and batsmen to hold their nerves in the big matches coming. I want Liton Das, Rahi in the XI today. " Sohel melbourne: "Just finished iftar and sitting on couch waiting to watch the match. Wondering how Hope goes well today. If got a century today it will make him proud like WI fan. Good luck !" Tanveer Syed: "How is the weather for today's match looking like? " --- According to those^ pictures, pretty darn good. Hello and welcome to ESPNcricinfo's ball-by-ball coverage of the tri-series ODI between Bangladesh and West Indies. Here's the preview of the game from Mohammad Isam, who by the way has more match-related news "Mohammad Saifuddin is suffering from a back injury, in addition to his tennis elbow. He might be sitting out today, likely to be replaced by Rubel Hossain."
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, 1 wide
Abu Jayed to Hope, no run
Abu Jayed to Hope, no run

items.text: he's a little squared up as Jayed gets the ball to straighten off the pitch. And since the length is beautiful as well - full but not drivable - Hope is stuck in his crease, playing towards mid-on. Ends up getting a leading edge into the covers
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, 1 run

items.text: solid forward defensive
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Ambris, no run

items.text: drives sweetly to mid-off
items.postText: Lipan Dutta: "Good that WI batting first. I want a 350+ score in first innings and BD chasing down the target. This will be a very good practice before going into big stage of WC. Best of luck to team in green and red."
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Ambris, no run

items.text: lovely shape again from Jayed, the outswing making sure Ambris' attempted flick through midwicket ends up near the point boundary
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Ambris, 3 runs

items.preText: Manoj: "Can any one let me know what is the official team name Windies or West Indies?" The cricket board has renamed them Windies a while back, but the new president, Ricky Skerrit, has said he'll undo all that. West Indies shall remain West Indies!
items.text: top shot! Spots the short ball early and wallops it to the midwicket boundary
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, FOUR runs

items.preText: Nitish: "Thanks to Statsguru. The last time Windies played an ODI with two left arm seamers was way back on the 1st of March 2006 when Deighton Butler and Ian Bradshaw took the field vs NZ at Napier. "
items.text: another short ball and another dismissive put-away! Mashrafe is too slow to be bowling that length. Especially when it doesn't even rise up to his hips. Ambris swivels in his back foot and pulls it behind square
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, FOUR runs

items.text: straying on the pads again and Ambris dabs it to the left of short fine leg
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.text: swing and miss as Mashrafe switches his line outside off. Plenty of room for the cut shot but maybe he goes at it too hard and loses his shape
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.text: targets the top of off and Ambris shuffles in his crease to flick the ball through straight midwicket
items.postText: Saeed Rasul: "I don't think Reifer is a #11 ... more like a #7." --- Yep, fair call. I remember him on Test debut in New Zealand taking it to Boult and co.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, 1 run

items.text: back of a length around off stump, he taps it to cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: top shot again! He's very good on the drive and Jayed offers up the invitation, pitching the ball up and offering room for Ambris to free the arms and lift it over extra cover
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Ambris, FOUR runs

items.text: fullish and this time he swings the ball into the right-hander - good tricks - and Ambris shows it some respect
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Ambris, no run

items.text: laces it through the covers. Outstanding shot from Ambris. He looks in a mood today. Although it doesn't take a genius to send a wide half volley packing
items.postText: Vinod Rajpal: "Good Afternoon Muthu....Am Not over with the hangover from yesterdays last ball thriller in IPL Finals !!" --- Didn't watch it. Too busy with City v Liverpool
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Ambris, FOUR runs

items.text: chops the back of a length delivery on off stump to deep third man
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Ambris, 1 run

items.preText: Mihir: "How about gayle and ambris opening for windies in the world cup"
items.text: another lovely drive, this time from Hope, as he stride forward confidently to the ball outside off. Finds mid-off though
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, no run

items.text: keeps him in his crease by pulling the length back. Hope is as careful as ever, defending the ball right under his eyes
items.postText: Aryan : "Why is Campbell not playing? Scored a wonderful knock of 180... Is he injured or something? " --- Yep. Back injury, IIRC
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, no run

items.text: cuts a shortish delivery to point. Not quite enough room to go full throttle
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.text: good technique, allowing the full, slightly slower, ball to come to him, and then artfully flicking it to midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.text: hits the deck a little harder and gets some response as the back of a length ball straigtens to take Ambris' outside edge behind point
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, 1 run

items.text: too easy as Mashrafe slips into the pads and Hope flicks it away to the backward square leg boundary.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, FOUR runs

items.text: full on off stump and Hope is on the drive immediately. Solidly hit but Mashrafe gets down to stop it himself
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: flicks a back of a length ball down to short fine leg
items.postText:
Gourav: "Have seen this Ambris guy for the first time during the test series between India and Windies. But he didnt have much impact those days...seems to be a changed man now"

Trichandra: "Good to see some intent from windies opener .300+ on the cards ?? " --- Possibly more.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, 1 run
